leadership.name: Ms. Julia Kute
leadership.bio: Ms. Julia Kute leads our STEM department with over 15 years of teaching experience. She specializes in Mathematics and Physics, having previously taught at several top-performing schools in the region. Her innovative teaching methods and dedication to student success have resulted in consistently excellent KCSE performance in STEM subjects. She mentors both teachers and students, fostering a culture of academic excellence and scientific inquiry.

leadership.name: Mr. Edwin Okello
leadership.bio: Mr. Edwin Okello brings a wealth of experience in humanities education, with expertise in History, Geography, and Literature. He has been instrumental in developing our school's cultural programs and debate teams. His leadership has led to numerous inter-school competition victories and has helped students develop critical thinking and communication skills essential for leadership roles.

leadership.name: Mr. Norman Origa
leadership.bio: Mr. Norman Origa oversees all co-curricular activities including sports, clubs, and cultural programs. With a background in Physical Education and Sports Management, he has transformed our school's sports programs, leading teams to county and regional competitions. He believes in holistic development and ensures every student finds their passion beyond academics.

leadership.name: Ms. Isdora Auma
leadership.bio: Ms. Isdora Auma leads our student welfare and guidance department, providing essential emotional and psychological support to students. With professional training in counseling and years of experience in adolescent psychology, she helps students navigate academic pressures, personal challenges, and future planning. Her work has significantly improved student wellbeing and academic performance.

leadership.name: Mr. Fredrick Otae
leadership.bio: Mr. Fredrick Otae works alongside Ms. Isdora in student welfare, focusing on discipline, conflict resolution, and student development programs. His approach emphasizes restorative justice and character building. He coordinates mentorship programs and ensures a safe, supportive environment for all students.

leadership.name: Ms. Mary Tago
leadership.bio: Ms. Mary Tago manages our comprehensive library and resource center, promoting reading culture and research skills among students. She has digitized our library system and created programs that have increased student engagement with literature and research materials. Her initiatives have significantly improved students' research and analytical abilities.
